channel.title: Total linux crash
channel.description:
Hello, i'm having a problem with linux. It's about the linux not responding at all (no mouse, no HDD, no CD, nothing responding) after 5 minutes of being in linux. I've been trying SUSE linux, Kubuntu, Ubuntu, Mandriva, and any operating system with a linux kernel. In a VM, this never happens.
SInce I installed my NVidia GeForce 7100 card, this has happened. Now i'm forced to be on windows. I believe the problem is because of my NVidia card, however, I found a driver, and it explains how to install it.
Yes, installing this driver is the problem, linux keeps crashing! I can't run anything for at least 1 minute before everything becomes unresponsive. I'm also completley unsure of how to use the kernel commands.

item.dc:creator: @Rajae Rajae
item.description:
@Rajae wrote:

Hey mopar!
I’ve tried running a live version of Kubuntu with one stick, and it didn’t even boot. I tried the other one, and it worked! It’s not crashing! I’m so excited now
The one that only works with windows is a DDR SDRAM memory chip. The one that works is a DDR only chip. SDRAM and DDR with Linux do NOT mix.
You helped a lot, now I don’t need a new motherboard.
This topic can be locked now, I solved the problem.
Thanks.
